meanings.sent1: In the story, the king's imperium allowed him to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The president's imperium over the country was unquestioned.
meanings.sent3: The imperium of the principal extended to deciding the school's lunch menu.
meanings.sent4: Her imperium in the household made her the undisputed leader of the family.
meanings.sent5: The imperium of the judge in the courtroom was evident in every ruling.

meanings.sent1: The emperor's imperium extended across vast lands.
meanings.sent2: The company's imperium in the industry was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The imperium of the cat over the house was clear as it lounged on the sofa.
meanings.sent4: His imperium over the team made him the go-to person for decisions.
meanings.sent5: The imperium of the storm over the sea was fearsome to behold.

meanings.sent1: The general's imperium allowed him to lead the army into battle.
meanings.sent2: The commander's imperium was evident in the soldiers' disciplined actions.
meanings.sent3: The imperium of the captain over the platoon was respected by all.
meanings.sent4: Her imperium on the battlefield inspired courage in her troops.
meanings.sent5: The imperium of the king to command his knights was legendary.
